publicationstmt.publisher: American Folklife Center, Library of Congress

seriesstmt.titleproper: Guides to the Collections in the Archive of Folk Culture

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Location
repository.corpname: Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center Library of Congress

physdesc.label: Extent (Sound Recordings)
physdesc.extent: 24 sound tape reels : analog, 7 1/2 and 15 ips, double track, stereo. ; 10 in.

did.langmaterial: English, Armenian, Chinese, Malinka, Polish, and Spanish
did.abstract: Manuscript materials, sound recordings, photographs, and color slides documenting the performance of bluegrass music, blues music, Armenian music, Senegalese music and dance, Irish music, country music, gospel music, Chinese traditional music and modern compositions, Caribbean music, and Polish music and dance celebrating the Harvest Festival from several regions in Poland. Most concerts were recorded live outdoors on Neptune Plaza in front of the Thomas Jefferson Building, Library of Congress. The concert of Chinese music was recorded in the Coolidge Auditorium, Library of Congress. The May 22 concert was held in celebration of the tenth anniversary of the Neptune Plaza Concert Series. Concerts were held from April through September 1986, sponsored by the American Folklife Center and the National Council for the Traditional Arts.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The 1986 Neptune Plaza Concert Series Collection consists of manuscript and print materials, audio recordings, and graphic materials that document the 1986 concert series sponsored by the American Folklife Center. The annual series, which began in 1977, features the presentation of folk traditions from many cultures. The concerts take place on the Neptune Plaza at the front of the Jefferson Building of the Library of Congress between May and September. Adverse weather conditions sometimes force the concerts indoors. The 1986 series was produced with the assistance of the National Council for the Traditional Arts.

The 1986 season consisted of the following:
Date Performers Place of Origin Subject
April 24 Byron Berline, Dan Crary, and John Hickman California Bluegrass music
May 1 John Jackson and James Jackson Virginia Blues music
May 22 Tenth Anniversary Concert: Leo Sarkisian and group; The Johnson Mountain Boys District of Columbia; Virginia Armenian music; Bluegrass music
June 5 Djimo Kouyate African Griot Tradition District of Columbia Senegalese music
June 19 The Irish Tradition Maryland Irish music
July 17 The Blue Ridge Mountain Boys String Band Virginia Old-time music
August 7 Pearl Williams-Jones and the Kings of Harmony District of Columbia Gospel music
August 21 Chinese Traditional and Folk Music Maryland Chinese music
September 18 María y sus Magníficos District of Columbia Caribbean music
September 25 Dawne Tańce and Tom Brzostowski District of Columbia Polish music

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: Documentation created and accessioned by the American Folklife Center in 1984.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject and listed alphabetically therein.

controlaccess.head: Organizations
controlaccess.corpname: Archive of Folk Culture (Library of Congress), collector.
Blue Ridge Mountain Boys (Musical group) performer.
María y sus Magníficos (Musical group) performer.
National Council for the Traditional Arts, sponsor.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Listening and viewing access to the collection is unrestricted. Duplication of the materials requires prior permission of the Center and may be governed by copyright and other restrictions.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: 1986 Neptune Plaza Concert Series Collection (AFC 1986/037), Archive of Folk Culture, American Folklife Center, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.
